subject: Ethics
title: Oppenheimer's Moral Crisis
description: A micro-lesson that makes Oppenheimer's Moral Crisis usable.

hook.text: After the first nuclear test, Oppenheimer quoted scripture: 'Now I am become Death, destroyer of worlds.'

buildup.text: J. Robert Oppenheimer led the Manhattan Project that built the atomic bomb. He was a heroâ€”briefly.

discovery.text: After Hiroshima, Oppenheimer lobbied against the hydrogen bomb, calling it a weapon of genocide.

twist.text: The government stripped his security clearance. The man who built the bomb was punished for opposing bigger ones.

climax.text: Oppenheimer's tragedy: you can't un-invent a weapon, and creating one doesn't give you power to control it.

punchline.text: He built the bomb, then begged the world not to use it.

quiz.question: Why did the U.S. government strip Oppenheimer's security clearance?
options: He was caught sharing nuclear secrets with the Soviet Union
He opposed the development of the even more powerful hydrogen bomb
He publicly criticized President Truman's decision to drop the bomb
